headers.subject: [tosdr:553] [Bad] IFTTT may change ToU without notification and assumes acceptance
headers.x-original-authentication-results: ls.google.com; spf=pass (google.com: domain of seppo0010@gmail.com designates internal as permitted sender) smtp.mail=seppo0010@gmail.com; dkim=pass header.i=@gmail.com

html:
Terms: http://ifttt.com/terms
 
IFTTT reserves the right, at its discretion, to update and change, from time to time, these Terms of Use. IFTTT may change these Terms of Use by posting a new version on the Site. You shall be responsible for reviewing and becoming familiar with any such modifications. Use of the Service after such change constitutes acceptance of such changes.

Sounds pretty bad to me. The user is responsible of checking the ToU for updates and continuing using the service is interpreted as an acceptance.

It is strange in the specific case of IFTTT since it has a passive usage of the service, because you can set up triggers that will continue to work even if you don't open the website.

--
www.tos-dr.info // www.twitter.com/tosdr // www.github.com/Unhosted/ToS-DR
---
You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "Terms of Service; Didn't Read" group.
To post to this group, send email to tosdr@googlegroups.com.
To unsubscribe from this group, send email to tosdr+unsubscribe@googlegroups.com.
Visit this group at http://groups.google.com/group/tosdr?hl=en.
For more options, visit https://groups.google.com/groups/opt_out.
subject: [Bad] IFTTT may change ToU without notification and assumes acceptance
text:
Terms: http://ifttt.com/terms
 

> IFTTT reserves the right, at its discretion, to update and change, from 
> time to time, these Terms of Use. IFTTT may change these Terms of Use by 
> posting a new version on the Site. You shall be responsible for reviewing 
> and becoming familiar with any such modifications. Use of the Service after 
> such change constitutes acceptance of such changes.


Sounds pretty bad to me. The user is responsible of checking the ToU for 
updates and continuing using the service is interpreted as an acceptance.

It is strange in the specific case of IFTTT since it has a passive usage of 
the service, because you can set up triggers that will continue to work 
even if you don't open the website.

--
